Comment: Hi guys. I played this game against my dad, which seems weird. I was black in the game, and I want you to notice how black took advantage of all the mistakes take white made in the game.
I responded with the Sicilian Defense.
All book.
Here I tryed playing the Najdorf with 2.d4 cxd4 3.Nxd4 Nf6 4.Nc3 a6 5.Be2 e5. This is not what I usually play, but it's worth a try.
Opening the center instead of playing the closed sicilian.

A very important move when you are trying to win the bishop pair.

Trying even harder to win the bishop pair.
?? At first I thought that my dad would give me the bishop pair, but then I realized that I could get something even better than the bishop pair...
A free minor piece! My queen forks the B on d3 and the rook on a1. Always look for these traps. They can really come in handy in you future games.
